title: 17.2 The Accounting Method
content:
Section 17.2

The Accounting Method

Summary

Charge each operation an amortized cost, store credit for later.

Key Points

  • Assign amortized cost (possibly different from actual) to each op
  • Overcharging stores credit with objects
  • Credit pays for future expensive operations
  • Rule: total amortized cost â‰¥ total actual cost
  • Credit can never go negative

Example

Stack: charge PUSH $2 (actual $1, store $1 credit). MULTIPOP uses stored credit. Amortized O(1) per op.

Why It Matters

Intuitive way to think about amortized analysis.
